section.title: Description
section.p: To configure servers into groups, use the group-manage command.

The Rack-Zone Awareness feature provides the ability to specify that active and corresponding replica partitions be created on servers that are part of a separate rack or zone. It enables logical groupings of servers on a cluster where each server group physically belongs to a rack or Availability Zone. Upgrade all server in a cluster to enable Rack-Zone Awareness.
section.note: The Rack-Zone Awareness feature with its server group capability is an Enterprise Edition feature.

section.title: Options
section.p: The following are the command options:

row.entry: The name of the group from which you are removing the servers.
The name of the group from to which you are adding the servers.
Services that run on the server. To specify multiple services, separate the service with a semi-colon. For example, --services=data;index.

refbody.section:
Examples
A server group is created:The command using the -create --group-name options can fail when an exclamation (!) is present inside the group name.
couchbase-cli group-manage -c 192.168.0.1:8091 -u myAdminName -p myAdminPassword --create --group-name=myGroupNameTwo servers are added to a server group using the group-manage command.couchbase-cli group-manage -c 192.168.0.1:8091 -u myAdminName -p myAdminPassword --group-name=myNewGroup --add-servers="10.1.1.1:8091;10.1.1.2:8091"
A server is added to the server group using the server-add command. The group-manage command is the preferred method for adding servers to server group.
One server with both the data and query services enabled is added to a server group using the group-manage command.couchbase-cli group-manage -c 192.168.0.1:8091 -u myAdminName -p myAdminPassword --group-name=myNewGroup --create --add-servers=10.1.1.1:8091 --services=data;query
Two servers are moved from one server group to another using the group-manage command.couchbase-cli group-manage -c 192.168.0.1:8091 -u myAdminName -p myAdminPassword --from-group=myFirstGroup --to-group=mySecondGroup --move-servers="10.1.1.1:8091;10.1.1.2:8091"
